There is a reason why decentralised exchanges haven‚Äôt taken off and part of the reason for that is the fact that they are slow and unreliable.  Our futures exchange is more of a hybrid model because the order matching system is purposely going to be on a centralised server because it‚Äôs much faster and much more reliable. State channels are also something we are looking at but again, the actual order matching system is centralised, it‚Äôs impossible to do real time trading on a fully decentralised platform. Author: sonagill
Title: [ANN][ICO] Digitex - Commission-free cryptocurrency futures exchange
Body: Digitex are having a second token sale!  Short version: WHAT: 100 million DGTX tokens will be offered for sale to the public on February 15th, 2018. HOW: We have bought back 148 million DGTX tokens from a very large buyer who bought them in our ICO on January 15th, 2018. WHY: We were uncomfortable with one buyer owning such a large amount of DGTX tokens and we wanted to redistribute them amongst thousands of smaller buyers for the long term benefit of the project going forward.  To participate, you buy DGTX tokens by sending ETH (Ether) to our smart contract address which will be published in the Auction Panel on Feb 15th.  Token auction will start at 9am EST on February 15th, 2018. Token auction will offer 100,000,000 DGTX tokens for sale to the public. There is a 10 ETH maximum buy in to ensure that no whales can buy large amounts of tokens.  Token sale mechanism will be a reverse auction where the DGTX token price starts high and then drops in price every hour until all tokens are sold at a price the market deems to be fair. As the DGTX auction price drops every hour, you send ETH to our token auction smart contract address when the price drops to the level at which you are happy to buy. If you are happy to pay whatever the market price is, you can send ETH to our smart contract when the auction starts and you will get DGTX tokens at whatever the final price ends up being. The token auction ends when the amount of money raised divided by the number of tokens for sale is equal to the auction price. The final DGTX token price is determined when the token auction ends and is guaranteed to be equal or less than the price you entered at. All buyers of DGTX tokens get the same price and the correct number of tokens will be distributed to each buyer at the end of the token auction according to how much ETH they sent in. The token auction page will clearly show the current auction price and how much ETH has been raised so far and will calculate and display the forecasted final DGTX price. Refer your friends and earn 30% of the ETH they spend in the token auction. Token auction smart contract code has been fully audited by SmartDec.net and will be posted publicly on github before the token auction.  Register for the reverse auction - https://digitexfutures.com/token-auction/ More information on the buy back of tokens from the whale - https://digitexfutures.com/dgtx-token-block-trade-on-feb-15th/ Our CEO Adam Todd explaining the reverse auction - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lHFXpaRAB3Q

Title: [ANN][ICO] Digitex - Commission-free cryptocurrency futures exchange

There will be no physical delivery of the underlying instrument such as Bitcoin or Ethereum or Litecoin. The futures markets on Digitex are 24 hour duration Contract For Difference contracts that settle every night at midnight and if you have an open position it is rolled over into the next contract that settles in 24 hours time. When the contract is settled at midnight at the price of the Global Bitcoin Price Index (GBX) from bitcoinaverage.com the traders profit or loss is cash settled in DGTX tokens.

The DGTX Token At the heart of the Digitex Futures Exchange is the DGTX token. As a true protocol token, its an integral part of how the exchange can operate without charging transaction fees. All account balances on the Digitex Futures Exchange are denominated in DGTX tokens and the tick value of every futures market is 1 DGTX, meaning that all trading profits and losses are in DGTX tokens.  Anyone who wants to trade on the commission-free markets of the Digitex Futures Exchange must therefore buy DGTX tokens, meaning that a busy futures exchange will be a massive source of demand for DGTX tokens. Any unsold DGTX tokens at the end of the token sale on February 15th will be burned to increase the value of the DGTX tokens that were bought.
